title.narrative: AMMAN XB EDUCATION

description.narrative: Education: Syria's conflict-affected children have their critical education needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of the UNICEF JOP, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: GRP2 2016-17: MENA Country Offices and the RO are empowered to deliver timely, equitable and principled humanitarian action, including through the cross-border component of the Syria programmes as part of the Whole of Syria response.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education: Syria?s conflict-affected children have their critical education needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of theUNICEF JOP

description.narrative: UNICEF provided vulnerable and displaced children with access to quality education in the southern and central governorates of Dara, Quneitra and Rural Damascus, including in the besieged locations of Eastern Ghouta. UNICEF and partners reached over 53,218 children with formal education support and 27,824 children with non-formal education. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017
